text: Is this in reference to email or in general
<@U7SL518D6> had a client that is asking if we can utilize the theme functions / UI ( without having a CLI uploaded folder)
essentially being able to meet in the middle for existing clients that are on CMS.

has anyone had success using a single theme across multiple brands for a single client? Use case: One of our clients has five brands in a portal. Each brand has its own site, with its own brand colors and logos, but all of the sites share identical layout, structure, neutral colors, and JS scripts.

at this time the fields.json and theme.json files have to be uploaded through the CLI. They can however can be edited in the design manager after upload.

We are actively thinking about the design manager experience with themes.
We've implemented multiple copies of the same theme for this purpose

Yeah what I’m trying to avoid is when they go “we need another block in the right column,” having to update five templates. Ideally, we’d update one master template somehow, but have different branding “layers” on it

Because what happens is the client has budget for the brand needing the update, but not for the other brands, and then things start getting out of sync and they come back going “why isn’t it on the other brands?” In an ideal world, clients would think like developers…. but reality is different.
Can I upload that into the root for instance to make it work with all templates / styles?

I have not tested whether you can upload a theme.json and fields.json to the root to turn everything into a theme. Even if it works, I would caution against doing that, as it would defeat part of the purpose of themes.

Instead I would create a new folder, add your theme and fields json there. then move your other assets inside of that folder. If you truly want to make all of that 1 theme
